Description: A full-length view of a bearded Graeco-Egyptian mummy; arms by his side; the skin blackened and shrivelled; the stomach and eyes sunken; remnants of gilding still adhering in parts; illustration to Pettigrew's "A History of Egyptian Mummies and an Acount of the Worship and Embalming of the Sacred Animals by the Egyptians" (1834) Aquatint
Bibliographic references: Reid 1871 / A descriptive catalogue of the works of George Cruikshank (1622)
Associated titles: A History of Egyptian Mummies and an Acount of the Worship and Embalming of the Sacred Animals by the Egyptians
